stimulusHtml: A disk is initially at rest on a tabletop when four forces, all with the same magnitude, are briefly exerted on the disk at the locations and in the directions shown in the top-view diagram. There is negligible friction between the disk and the tabletop. Which of the following correctly describes the motion of the disk immediately after the forces have been exerted?
choicesHtml: The disk will rotate at a constant angular speed.
The disk will rotate with an increasing angular speed.
The disk will rotate with a decreasing angular speed.
The disk will be at rest and not rotating.
